CLASS Solution
    FUNCTION longestPalindrome(s)
        SET length AS THE COUNT OF s
        SET truth_matrix AS AN ARRAY (length) OF ARRAYS (length) FILLED WITH TRUE
        SET start_index AS 0
        SET max_length AS 1
        
        SET outer_index AS length MINUS 2
        WHILE outer_index IS GREATER THAN OR EQUAL TO 0 DO
            SET inner_index AS outer_index PLUS 1
            WHILE inner_index IS LESS THAN length DO
                SET truth_matrix[outer_index][inner_index] AS FALSE
                
                IF NOT (s[outer_index] NOT EQUAL TO s[inner_index]) THEN
                    SET truth_matrix[outer_index][inner_index] AS truth_matrix[outer_index PLUS 1][inner_index MINUS 1]
                    
                    IF truth_matrix[outer_index][inner_index] IS TRUE THEN
                        IF (max_length LESS THAN (inner_index MINUS outer_index PLUS 1)) THEN
                            SET start_index AS outer_index
                            SET max_length AS (inner_index MINUS outer_index PLUS 1)
                        END IF
                    END IF
                END IF
                INCREMENT inner_index BY 1
            END WHILE
            DECREMENT outer_index BY 1
        END WHILE
        
        RETURN s SUBSTRING FROM start_index TO (start_index PLUS max_length MINUS 1)
    END FUNCTION
END CLASS

CLASS Solution  
    FUNCTION longestPalindrome(s)  
        SET n TO the LENGTH OF s  
        SET f TO a TWO DIMENSIONAL LIST of BOOLEAN TRUES with n ROWS and n COLUMNS  
        SET k TO zero  
        SET mx TO one  
        FOR i FROM n MINUS two DOWN TO zero  
            FOR j FROM i PLUS one TO n MINUS one  
                SET element at position i and position j of f TO FALSE  
                IF element at position i of s EQUALS element at position j of s  
                    SET element at position i and position j of f TO element at position i PLUS one and position j MINUS one of f  
                    IF element at position i and position j of f EQUALS TRUE AND mx LESS THAN j MINUS i PLUS one  
                        SET k TO i  
                        SET mx TO j MINUS i PLUS one  
                    END IF  
                END IF  
            END FOR  
        END FOR  
        RETURN substring from position k TO position k PLUS mx MINUS one of s  
    END FUNCTION  
END CLASS

CLASS Solution  
    FUNCTION myAtoi(s)  
        SET maxIntValue AS (2 ^ 31) - 1  
        SET minIntValue AS 0 - (2 ^ 31)  
        SET accumulatedNumber TO 0  
        SET position TO 0  
        SET lengthOfString TO LENGTH OF s  
        SET polarity TO 1  

        WHILE position < lengthOfString AND s[position] = ' '  
            position ← position + 1  
        END WHILE  

        IF position < lengthOfString THEN  
            SWITCH s[position]  
                CASE '-'  
                    polarity ← 0 - 1  
                    position ← position + 1  
                    BREAK  
                CASE '+'  
                    polarity ← 1  
                    position ← position + 1  
                    BREAK  
            END SWITCH  
        END IF  

        REPEAT UNTIL NOT (position < lengthOfString AND s[position] >= '0' AND s[position] <= '9')  
            SET currentChar TO s[position]  
            SET numericValue TO INTEGER VALUE OF currentChar  
            SET boundaryCheck TO maxIntValue - (numericValue DIV 10)  

            IF accumulatedNumber > boundaryCheck THEN  
                IF polarity = 1 THEN  
                    RETURN maxIntValue  
                ELSE  
                    RETURN minIntValue  
                END IF  
            END IF  

            accumulatedNumber ← (accumulatedNumber * 10) + numericValue  
            position ← position + 1  
        END REPEAT  

        RETURN polarity * accumulatedNumber  
    END FUNCTION  
END CLASS

CLASS Solution  
    FUNCTION myAtoi(s)  
        SET INT_MAX TO two RAISED TO THE POWER OF thirty ONE MINUS one  
        SET INT_MIN TO the NEGATIVE of two RAISED TO THE POWER OF thirty ONE  
        SET result TO zero  
        SET index TO zero  
        SET n TO the LENGTH OF s  
        SET sign TO one  
        WHILE index LESS THAN n AND element at position index of s EQUALS the space character  
            INCREMENT index BY one  
        END WHILE  
        IF index LESS THAN n AND (element at position index of s EQUALS the plus character OR element at position index of s EQUALS the minus character)  
            IF element at position index of s EQUALS the minus character  
                SET sign TO the NEGATIVE of one  
            ELSE  
                SET sign TO one  
            END IF  
            INCREMENT index BY one  
        END IF  
        WHILE index LESS THAN n AND element at position index of s IS A DIGIT  
            SET digit TO the INTEGER VALUE OF element at position index of s  
            IF result GREATER THAN INT_MAX MINUS digit DIVIDED BY ten  
                IF sign EQUALS one  
                    RETURN INT_MAX  
                ELSE  
                    RETURN INT_MIN  
                END IF  
            END IF  
            SET result TO result MULTIPLIED BY ten PLUS digit  
            INCREMENT index BY one  
        END WHILE  
        RETURN sign MULTIPLIED BY result  
    END FUNCTION  
END CLASS

CLASS Solution  
    FUNCTION isMatch(s, p)  
        DECLARE table AS two-dimensional array FILLED WITH False, SIZE (length(s) + 1) BY (length(p) + 1)  
        ASSIGN table[0][0] ← True  

        SET indexP TO 1  
        WHILE indexP ≤ length(p)  
            IF p[indexP - 1] = '*' THEN  
                ASSIGN table[0][indexP] ← table[0][indexP - 1]  
            END IF  
            INCREMENT indexP BY 1  
        END WHILE  

        SET indexS TO 1  
        WHILE indexS ≤ length(s)  
            SET indexPTmp TO 1  
            WHILE indexPTmp ≤ length(p)  
                IF p[indexPTmp - 1] = '*' THEN  
                    ASSIGN table[indexS][indexPTmp] ← (table[indexS - 1][indexPTmp] OR table[indexS][indexPTmp - 1])  
                ELSE  
                    IF (p[indexPTmp - 1] = '?' OR s[indexS - 1] = p[indexPTmp - 1]) THEN  
                        ASSIGN table[indexS][indexPTmp] ← table[indexS - 1][indexPTmp - 1]  
                    END IF  
                END IF  
                SET indexPTmp ← indexPTmp + 1  
            END WHILE  
            SET indexS ← indexS + 1  
        END WHILE  

        RETURN table[length(s)][length(p)]  
    END FUNCTION  
END CLASS

            IF element at position j MINUS one of p EQUALS the character representing asterisk  
                SET element at position zero j of dp TO the value of element at position zero j MINUS one of dp

        END FOR

            FOR j FROM one TO the length of p  
                IF element at position j MINUS one of p EQUALS the character representing asterisk

                ELSE IF element at position j MINUS one of p EQUALS the character representing question mark OR element at position i MINUS one of s EQUALS element at position j MINUS one of p  
                    SET element at position i j of dp TO the value of element at position i MINUS one j MINUS one of dp  
                END IF  
            END FOR  
        END FOR  
        RETURN element at position the length of s the length of p of dp  
    END FUNCTION

CLASS Solution  
    FUNCTION removeDuplicates(nums)  
        IF NOT (LENGTH OF nums > 0) THEN  
            RETURN 0  
        END IF  
        
        SET ptr AS 0  
        
        SET idx AS 0  
        WHILE idx <= (2 MINUS 1) AND idx <= (LENGTH OF nums MINUS 1)  
            ASSIGN nums[ptr] AS nums[idx]  
            SET ptr AS ptr + 1  
            SET idx AS idx + 1  
        END WHILE  
        
        SET cursor AS 2  
        WHILE cursor <= (LENGTH OF nums MINUS 1)  
            IF nums[cursor] = nums[(ptr MINUS 2)] THEN  
                # do nothing, skip increment  
            ELSE  
                ASSIGN nums[ptr] AS nums[cursor]  
                SET ptr AS ptr PLUS 1  
            END IF  
            SET cursor AS cursor + 1  
        END WHILE  
        
        RETURN ptr  
    END FUNCTION  
END CLASS

CLASS Solution
    FUNCTION evalRPN(tokens)
        INITIALIZE ledger WITH empty collection
        INITIALIZE index TO 0
        WHILE index LESS THAN LENGTH OF tokens
            LET current_token BE tokens[index]
            INCREMENT index BY 1
            SWITCH current_token
                CASE plus, minus, multiply, divide:
                    LET right_operand BE ledger.REMOVE_LAST_ELEMENT()
                    LET left_operand BE ledger.REMOVE_LAST_ELEMENT()
                    IF current_token EQUALS plus THEN
                        SET operation_result TO left_operand PLUS right_operand
                    ELSE IF current_token EQUALS minus THEN
                        SET operation_result TO left_operand MINUS right_operand
                    ELSE IF current_token EQUALS multiply THEN
                        SET operation_result TO left_operand MULTIPLIED BY right_operand
                    ELSE /* current_token EQUALS divide */
                        SET intermediate_result TO left_operand DIVIDED BY right_operand
                        SET operation_result TO INTEGER_VALUE_OF(intermediate_result)
                    END IF
                    ledger.ADD_ELEMENT(operation_result)
                DEFAULT:
                    LET numeric_value BE INTEGER_VALUE_OF(current_token)
                    ledger.ADD_ELEMENT(numeric_value)
            END SWITCH
        END WHILE
        RETURN ledger[0]
    END FUNCTION
END CLASS

CLASS Solution  
    FUNCTION evalRPN(tokens)  
        SET stack TO an empty list  
        FOR each token IN tokens  
            IF token EQUALS one of the symbols plus MINUS MULTIPLY DIVIDE  
                SET b TO the last element removed from stack  
                SET a TO the last element removed from stack  
                IF token EQUALS plus  
                    APPEND a PLUS b TO stack  
                ELSE IF token EQUALS minus  
                    APPEND a MINUS b TO stack  
                ELSE IF token EQUALS multiply  
                    APPEND a MULTIPLIED BY b TO stack  
                ELSE IF token EQUALS divide  
                    APPEND the integer value of a DIVIDED BY b TO stack  
                END IF  
            ELSE  
                APPEND the integer value of token TO stack  
            END IF  
        END FOR  
        RETURN the element at position zero of stack  
    END FUNCTION  
END CLASS

CLASS Solution  
    FUNCTION countPrimes WITH PARAMETER n  
        SWITCH  
            CASE n > 2:  
                BREAK  
            DEFAULT:  
                RETURN 0  
        END SWITCH  
        SET primality_flags AS empty list  
        SET counter AS 0  
        WHILE counter IS LESS THAN n DO  
            ADD True TO primality_flags  
            SET counter TO counter + 1  
        END WHILE  
        SET primality_flags[0] TO False  
        SET primality_flags[1] TO False  
        SET max_check AS FLOOR(SQRT(n))  
        SET candidate AS 2  
        WHILE candidate <= max_check DO  
            IF primality_flags[candidate] IS NOT False THEN  
                SET factor AS candidate * candidate  
                WHILE factor < n DO  
                    SET primality_flags[factor] TO False  
                    SET factor TO factor + candidate  
                END WHILE  
            END IF  
            SET candidate TO candidate + 1  
        END WHILE  
        SET tally AS 0  
        FOR element IN primality_flags DO  
            IF element THEN tally ← tally + 1  
        END FOR  
        RETURN tally  
    END FUNCTION  
END CLASS

CLASS Solution  
    FUNCTION countPrimes WITH PARAMETER n  
        IF n LESS THAN OR EQUAL TO two  
            RETURN zero  
        END IF  
        SET is_prime TO an empty list  
        FOR index FROM zero TO n MINUS one  
            APPEND True TO is_prime  
        END FOR  
        SET element at position zero of is_prime TO False  
        SET element at position one of is_prime TO False  
        SET limit TO the integer part of the square root of n  
        FOR start FROM two TO limit PLUS one  
            IF element at position start of is_prime EQUALS True  
                SET multiple TO start MULTIPLIED BY start  
                WHILE multiple LESS THAN n  
                    SET element at position multiple of is_prime TO False  
                    INCREMENT multiple BY start  
                END WHILE  
            END IF  
        END FOR  
        SET count TO zero  
        FOR each value IN is_prime  
            IF value EQUALS True  
                INCREMENT count BY one  
            END IF  
        END FOR  
        RETURN count  
    END FUNCTION  
END CLASS

CLASS Solution
    FUNCTION strobogrammaticInRange(low  
                                    high)
        FUNCTION generate_strobogrammatic(n  
                                         final_length)
            SWITCH n
                CASE 0:
                    RETURN [""]

                CASE 1:
                    RETURN ["0", "1", "8"]
            END SWITCH

            SET innerStrings AS generate_strobogrammatic(final_length - 2, final_length)
            SET collection AS []

            SET idx TO 0
            WHILE idx < LENGTH(innerStrings)
                SET segment TO innerStrings[idx]

                IF n IS DIFFERENT FROM final_length THEN
                    INSERT "0" + segment + "0" INTO collection AT END
                END IF

                INSERT "1" + segment + "1" INTO collection AT END
                INSERT "6" + segment + "9" INTO collection AT END
                INSERT "8" + segment + "8" INTO collection AT END
                INSERT "9" + segment + "6" INTO collection AT END

                idx ← idx + 1
            END WHILE

            RETURN collection
        END FUNCTION

        FUNCTION count_strobogrammatic(low  
                                       high)
            SET total AS 0
            SET lenLow TO LENGTH(low)
            SET lenHigh TO LENGTH(high)

            SET currentLen TO lenLow
            WHILE currentLen <= lenHigh
                SET generatedList AS generate_strobogrammatic(currentLen, currentLen)
                SET pointer TO 0

                WHILE pointer < LENGTH(generatedList)
                    SET numberStr TO generatedList[pointer]

                    IF NOT ((currentLen = lenLow AND numberStr < low) OR (currentLen = lenHigh AND numberStr > high)) THEN
                        total ← total + 1
                    END IF

                    pointer ← pointer + 1
                END WHILE

                currentLen ← currentLen + 1
            END WHILE

            RETURN total
        END FUNCTION

        RETURN count_strobogrammatic(low, high)
    END FUNCTION
END CLASS

CLASS Solution  
    FUNCTION strobogrammaticInRange(low  
                                    high)  
        FUNCTION generate_strobogrammatic(n  
                                         final_length)  
            IF n EQUALS zero  
                RETURN a list containing an empty string  
            END IF  
            
            IF n EQUALS one  
                RETURN a list containing the string zero once the string one once the string eight  
            END IF  
            
            SET middles TO the result of calling generate_strobogrammatic with arguments n MINUS two and final_length  
            SET result TO an empty list  
            FOR each middle IN middles  
                IF n NOT EQUALS final_length  
                    APPEND the string zero PLUS middle PLUS zero TO result  
                END IF  
                APPEND the string one PLUS middle PLUS one TO result  
                APPEND the string six PLUS middle PLUS nine TO result  
                APPEND the string eight PLUS middle PLUS eight TO result  
                APPEND the string nine PLUS middle PLUS six TO result  
            END FOR  
            RETURN result  
        END FUNCTION  
        
        FUNCTION count_strobogrammatic(low  
                                       high)  
            SET count TO zero  
            FOR length FROM the length of low TO the length of high  
                FOR each num IN the result of calling generate_strobogrammatic with arguments length and length  
                    IF (length EQUALS the length of low AND num LESS THAN low) OR (length EQUALS the length of high AND num GREATER THAN high)  
                        CONTINUE to the next iteration  
                    END IF  
                    INCREMENT count BY one  
                END FOR  
            END FOR  
            RETURN count  
        END FUNCTION  
        
        RETURN the result of calling count_strobogrammatic with arguments low and high  
    END FUNCTION  
END CLASS

CLASS Solution  
    FUNCTION getHint(secret PARAMETER, guess PARAMETER)  
        IMPORT a data structure offering a dictionary with zero as the default for any missing key  
        
        SET alpha TO 0  
        SET beta TO 0  
        
        CREATE secret_map AS a dictionary defaulting to zero  
        CREATE guess_map AS a dictionary defaulting to zero  
        
        SET counter TO 0  
        WHILE counter LESS THAN LENGTH(secret)  
            SET secret_char TO secret[counter]  
            SET guess_char TO guess[counter]  
            
            IF NOT (secret_char DIFFERENT FROM guess_char) THEN
                SET alpha TO alpha + 1
            ELSE
                INCREASE secret_map[secret_char] BY 1
                INCREASE guess_map[guess_char] BY 1
            END IF  
            SET counter TO counter + 1
        END WHILE  
        
        FOR each key_element IN secret_map KEYS  
            SET min_val TO guess_map[key_element]  
            IF min_val GREATER THAN secret_map[key_element] THEN
                SET min_val TO secret_map[key_element]
            END IF
            SET beta TO beta + min_val
        END FOR  
        
        RETURN (string CONCAT alpha CONCAT "A" CONCAT beta CONCAT "B")  
    END FUNCTION  
END CLASS

CLASS Solution  
    FUNCTION getHint(secret PARAMETER, guess PARAMETER)  
        IMPORT a data structure that provides a dictionary with default zero values
        
        SET bulls TO zero  
        SET cows TO zero  
        
        CREATE a dictionary named secret_count with default zero values  
        CREATE a dictionary named guess_count with default zero values  
        
        FOR each element s and element g taken correspondingly from secret and guess  
            IF element s EQUALS element g  
                INCREMENT bulls BY one  
            ELSE  
                INCREMENT the value at key element s in secret_count BY one  
                INCREMENT the value at key element g in guess_count BY one  
            END IF  
        END FOR  
        
        FOR each digit IN the keys of secret_count  
            INCREMENT cows BY the smaller value BETWEEN the value at key digit in secret_count AND the value at key digit in guess_count  
        END FOR  
        
        RETURN a string expressing bulls FOLLOWED BY the character representing bulls AND THEN cows FOLLOWED BY the character representing cows  
    END FUNCTION  
END CLASS

CLASS Solution  
    FUNCTION integerBreak(n)  
        SET dpList AS an array of zeros sized n PLUS 1  
        SET dpList[1] AS 1  
        SET outerCounter TO 2  
        WHILE outerCounter IS LESS THAN OR EQUAL TO n DO  
            SET currentMax TO 0  
            SET innerCounter TO 1  
            WHILE innerCounter IS LESS THAN outerCounter DO  
                SET firstProduct TO innerCounter TIMES dpList[outerCounter MINUS innerCounter]  
                SET secondProduct TO innerCounter TIMES (outerCounter MINUS innerCounter)  
                SWITCH TRUE  
                    CASE currentMax < firstProduct AND currentMax < secondProduct:  
                        IF firstProduct > secondProduct THEN  
                            SET currentMax TO firstProduct  
                        ELSE  
                            SET currentMax TO secondProduct  
                        END IF  
                    CASE currentMax < firstProduct:  
                        SET currentMax TO firstProduct  
                    CASE currentMax < secondProduct:  
                        SET currentMax TO secondProduct  
                END SWITCH  
                INCREMENT innerCounter BY 1  
            END WHILE  
            SET dpList[outerCounter] TO currentMax  
            INCREMENT outerCounter BY 1  
        END WHILE  
        RETURN dpList[n]  
    END FUNCTION  
END CLASS

        FOR i FROM two TO n  
            SET max_product TO zero  
            FOR j FROM one TO i MINUS one  
                SET product_one TO j MULTIPLIED BY element at position i MINUS j of dp  
                SET product_two TO j MULTIPLIED BY i MINUS j  
                IF max_product LESS THAN product_one AND max_product LESS THAN product_two  
                    SET max_product TO the larger value BETWEEN product_one AND product_two  
                ELSE IF max_product LESS THAN product_one  
                    SET max_product TO product_one  
                ELSE IF max_product LESS THAN product_two  
                    SET max_product TO product_two  
                END IF  
            END FOR  
            SET element at position i of dp TO max_product  
        END FOR  
        RETURN element at position n of dp  
    END FUNCTION  
END CLASS

CLASS Solution  
    FUNCTION isRectangleCover(rectangles)  
        LET minX BE positive infinity  
        LET minY BE positive infinity  
        LET maxX BE negative infinity  
        LET maxY BE negative infinity  
        
        INITIALIZE corners AS empty set  
        DEFINE totalArea AS 0  
        
        DEFINE idx AS 0  
        WHILE idx LESS THAN LENGTH OF rectangles DO  
            LET rect BE rectangles[idx]  
            LET leftX BE rect[0]  
            LET bottomY BE rect[1]  
            LET rightX BE rect[2]  
            LET topY BE rect[3]  
            
            IF NOT (leftX >= minX) THEN  
                minX ← leftX  
            END IF  
            IF NOT (bottomY >= minY) THEN  
                minY ← bottomY  
            END IF  
            IF NOT (rightX <= maxX) THEN  
                maxX ← rightX  
            END IF  
            IF NOT (topY <= maxY) THEN  
                maxY ← topY  
            END IF  
            
            LET rectArea BE (rightX - leftX)  
            LET height BE (topY - bottomY)  
            LET thisArea BE rectArea * height  
            totalArea ← totalArea + thisArea  
            
            LET cornerPoints BE list of pairs: (leftX, bottomY), (leftX, topY), (rightX, bottomY), (rightX, topY)  
            
            LET ctr AS 0  
            WHILE ctr LESS THAN LENGTH OF cornerPoints DO  
                LET corner BE cornerPoints[ctr]  
                IF corners CONTAINS corner THEN  
                    REMOVE corner FROM corners  
                ELSE  
                    INSERT corner INTO corners  
                END IF  
                ctr ← ctr + 1  
            END WHILE  
            idx ← idx + 1  
        END WHILE  
        
        LET fullWidth BE maxX - minX  
        LET fullHeight BE maxY - minY  
        LET expectedArea BE fullWidth * fullHeight  
        
        IF totalArea IS NOT expectedArea THEN  
            RETURN False  
        END IF  
        
        LET requiredCorners BE set of pairs: (minX, minY), (minX, maxY), (maxX, minY), (maxX, maxY)  
        IF corners IS NOT EQUAL TO requiredCorners THEN  
            RETURN False  
        END IF  
        
        RETURN True  
    END FUNCTION  
END CLASS

CLASS Solution
    FUNCTION canCross(stones)
        IF stones IS EMPTY OR NOT (LENGTH stones >= 2)
            OUTPUT False
        END IF
        LET pebbleBank BE A HASH MAP(initialized empty)
        LET cache BE A HASH MAP(empty)

        FUNCTION can_jump_to(loc, step)
            IF loc = stones[LENGTH stones - 1]
                OUTPUT True
            END IF
            IF (loc, step) EXISTS IN cache
                OUTPUT cache[(loc, step)]
            END IF
            LET delta BE -1
            WHILE delta <= 1
                LET candidateStep BE step + delta
                IF candidateStep > 0 AND (loc + candidateStep) IN pebbleBank
                    IF can_jump_to(loc + candidateStep, candidateStep)
                        SET cache[(loc, step)] AS True
                        OUTPUT True
                    END IF
                END IF
                INCREMENT delta BY 1
            END WHILE
            SET cache[(loc, step)] AS False
            OUTPUT False
        END FUNCTION

        FOR peb IN stones
            SET pebbleBank[peb] AS True
        END FOR

        OUTPUT can_jump_to(stones[0], 0)
    END FUNCTION
END CLASS

CLASS Solution  
    FUNCTION canCross(stones)  
        IF stones EQUALS empty OR the LENGTH OF stones LESS THAN two  
            RETURN False  
        END IF  
        SET stone_set TO the SET of all elements in stones  
        SET memo TO an EMPTY DICTIONARY  

        FUNCTION can_jump_to(position, jump)  
            IF position EQUALS the element at the last position of stones  
                RETURN True  
            END IF  
            IF the TUPLE of position AND jump IS IN memo  
                RETURN the VALUE associated with the TUPLE of position AND jump in memo  
            END IF  
            FOR next_jump FROM jump MINUS one TO jump PLUS one  
                IF next_jump GREATER THAN zero AND the SUM of position AND next_jump IS IN stone_set

            SET memo at key TUPLE of position AND jump TO False  
            RETURN False  
        END FUNCTION

    END FUNCTION  
END CLASS

CLASS Solution
    FUNCTION wordSquares(words)
        SET lookup TO an empty mapping from string to list of strings

        SET w_index TO 0
        WHILE w_index < LENGTH(words)
            SET current_word TO words[w_index]
            SET i TO 0
            WHILE i < LENGTH(current_word)
                SET key TO substring(current_word, 0, i)
                IF NOT lookup HAS KEY key THEN
                    lookup[key] ← an empty list
                END IF
                SET word_list TO lookup[key]
                word_list ← word_list + [current_word]
                lookup[key] ← word_list
                i ← i + 1
            END WHILE
            w_index ← w_index + 1
        END WHILE

        SET output TO an empty list

        FUNCTION backtrack(square)
            IF NOT LENGTH(square) ≠ LENGTH(words[0]) THEN
                output ← output + [square]
                RETURN
            END IF

            SET build_prefix TO ""
            SET idx TO 0
            WHILE idx < LENGTH(square)
                SET temp_word TO square[idx]
                SET prefix_char TO temp_word[LENGTH(square)]
                build_prefix ← build_prefix + prefix_char
                idx ← idx + 1
            END WHILE

            IF lookup HAS KEY build_prefix THEN
                SET candidates_list TO lookup[build_prefix]
                SET c_idx TO 0
                WHILE c_idx < LENGTH(candidates_list)
                    SET next_word TO candidates_list[c_idx]
                    backtrack(square + [next_word])
                    c_idx ← c_idx + 1
                END WHILE
            END IF
        END FUNCTION

        FOR EACH initial_word IN words
            backtrack([initial_word])
        END FOR

        RETURN output
    END FUNCTION
END CLASS

    FUNCTION findMaxForm(strs, m, n)

        WHILE INDEX < LENGTH OF strs  
            STRING currentString ← strs AT INDEX  
            ZEROES ← 0  
            ONES ← 0  
            
            POSITION ← 0  
            WHILE POSITION < LENGTH OF currentString  
                CHARACTER char ← currentString AT POSITION  
                IF char = '0' THEN  
                    ZEROES ← ZEROES + 1  
                ELSE IF char = '1' THEN  
                    ONES ← ONES + 1  
                END IF  
                POSITION ← POSITION + 1  
            END WHILE  
            
            iCounter ← m  
            WHILE iCounter >= ZEROES  
                jCounter ← n  
                REPEAT  
                    currentVal ← matrix AT iCounter AT jCounter  
                    candidateVal ← matrix AT (iCounter - ZEROES) AT (jCounter - ONES) + 1  
                    
                    IF candidateVal > currentVal THEN  
                        matrix AT iCounter AT jCounter ← candidateVal  
                    END IF  
                    jCounter ← jCounter - 1  
                UNTIL jCounter < ONES  
                iCounter ← iCounter - 1  
            END WHILE  
            
            INDEX ← INDEX + 1  
        END WHILE  
        
        RETURN matrix AT m AT n  
    END FUNCTION  
END CLASS

CLASS Solution
    FUNCTION medianSlidingWindow(nums k)
        ASSIGN [] TO alpha
        ASSIGN [] TO beta

        FUNCTION balance_heaps()
            WHEN LENGTH(alpha) > LENGTH(beta) + 1:
                CALL heappush beta NEGATE CALL heappop alpha
            OTHERWISE WHEN LENGTH(beta) > LENGTH(alpha):
                CALL heappush alpha NEGATE CALL heappop beta
            END WHEN
        END FUNCTION

        FUNCTION add_num(delta)
            WHEN LENGTH(alpha) = 0 OR delta <= NEGATE alpha[0]:
                CALL heappush alpha NEGATE delta
            OTHERWISE:
                CALL heappush beta delta
            END WHEN
            CALL balance_heaps()
        END FUNCTION

        FUNCTION remove_num(delta)
            WHEN delta <= NEGATE alpha[0]:
                DELETE element NEGATE delta FROM alpha
                WHEN LENGTH(alpha) > 0:
                    CALL heapify alpha
                END WHEN
            OTHERWISE:
                DELETE element delta FROM beta
                WHEN LENGTH(beta) > 0:
                    CALL heapify beta
                END WHEN
            END WHEN
            CALL balance_heaps()
        END FUNCTION

        FUNCTION get_median()
            WHEN LENGTH(alpha) > LENGTH(beta):
                RETURN NEGATE alpha[0]
            END WHEN
            RETURN (NEGATE alpha[0] + beta[0]) / 2
        END FUNCTION

        ASSIGN 0 TO mu
        WHILE mu < k:
            CALL add_num nums[mu]
            ASSIGN mu + 1 TO mu
        END WHILE

        ASSIGN [get_median()] TO omegas

        ASSIGN k TO pi
        WHILE NOT (pi >= LENGTH(nums)):
            CALL add_num nums[pi]
            CALL remove_num nums[pi - k]
            APPEND get_median() TO omegas
            ASSIGN pi + 1 TO pi
        END WHILE

        RETURN omegas
    END FUNCTION
END CLASS

    FUNCTION medianSlidingWindow(nums k)  
        SET lo TO empty list  
        SET hi TO empty list  

        FUNCTION balance_heaps()  
            IF the LENGTH OF lo IS GREATER THAN the LENGTH OF hi PLUS one  
                CALL heappush WITH the argument hi AND NEGATIVE of the result of heappop ON lo  
            ELSE IF the LENGTH OF hi IS GREATER THAN the LENGTH OF lo  
                CALL heappush WITH the argument lo AND NEGATIVE of the result of heappop ON hi  
            END IF  
        END FUNCTION  

        FUNCTION add_num(num)  
            IF lo IS empty OR num IS LESS THAN OR EQUAL TO NEGATIVE of element at position zero of lo  
                CALL heappush WITH the argument lo AND NEGATIVE num  
            ELSE  
                CALL heappush WITH the argument hi AND num  
            END IF  
            CALL balance_heaps()  
        END FUNCTION  

        FUNCTION remove_num(num)  
            IF num IS LESS THAN OR EQUAL TO NEGATIVE of element at position zero of lo  
                REMOVE NEGATIVE num FROM lo  
                IF lo IS NOT empty  
                    CALL heapify WITH the argument lo  
                END IF  
            ELSE  
                REMOVE num FROM hi  
                IF hi IS NOT empty  
                    CALL heapify WITH the argument hi  
                END IF  
            END IF  
            CALL balance_heaps()  
        END FUNCTION  

        FUNCTION get_median()  
            IF the LENGTH OF lo IS GREATER THAN the LENGTH OF hi  
                RETURN NEGATIVE of element at position zero of lo  
            END IF  
            RETURN NEGATIVE of element at position zero of lo PLUS element at position zero of hi DIVIDED BY two  
        END FUNCTION  

        FOR i FROM zero TO k MINUS one  
            CALL add_num WITH element at position i of nums  
        END FOR  

        SET medians TO a list containing the result of get_median()  

        FOR i FROM k TO the LENGTH OF nums MINUS one  
            CALL add_num WITH element at position i of nums  
            CALL remove_num WITH element at position i MINUS k of nums  
            APPEND the result of get_median() TO medians  
        END FOR  

        RETURN medians  
    END FUNCTION  
END CLASS

    FUNCTION minDistance(word1, word2)  
        ASSIGN length1 ← LENGTH OF word1  
        ASSIGN length2 ← LENGTH OF word2

        ASSIGN outerCounter ← 1  
        WHILE outerCounter <= length1  
            ASSIGN innerCounter ← 1  
            WHILE innerCounter <= length2

                ASSIGN charFromWord2 ← word2[innerCounter MINUS 1]

                ELSE  
                    ASSIGN topValue ← dp[outerCounter MINUS 1][innerCounter]  
                    ASSIGN leftValue ← dp[outerCounter][innerCounter MINUS 1]  
                    
                    IF topValue >= leftValue THEN  
                        SET dp[outerCounter][innerCounter] ← topValue  
                    ELSE  
                        SET dp[outerCounter][innerCounter] ← leftValue  
                    END IF  
                END IF  
                
                INCREMENT innerCounter BY 1  
            END WHILE  
            INCREMENT outerCounter BY 1  
        END WHILE  
        
        ASSIGN lcsLength ← dp[length1][length2]  
        
        RETURN (length1 MINUS lcsLength) PLUS (length2 MINUS lcsLength)  
    END FUNCTION

CLASS Solution  
    FUNCTION findIntegers(n)  
        ASSIGN binaryString ← ""  
        ASSIGN tempNumber ← n  
        WHILE tempNumber > 0  
            SET binaryString ← ( (tempNumber MOD 2) AS STRING ) + binaryString  
            SET tempNumber ← tempNumber DIV 2  
        END WHILE

        SET totalLength ← LENGTH OF binaryString  
        CREATE dp ARRAY WITH SIZE totalLength + 1 FILLED WITH 0  
        SET dp[0] ← 1  
        SET dp[1] ← 2  

        SET counter ← 2  
        WHILE counter ≤ totalLength  
            SET dp[counter] ← dp[counter - 1] + dp[counter - 2]  
            INCREMENT counter BY 1  
        END WHILE

        SET accumulatedResult ← 0  
        SET lastBit ← 0  
        SET position ← 0  

        WHILE position < totalLength  
            SWITCH binaryString[position]  
                CASE '1':  
                    SET accumulatedResult ← accumulatedResult + dp[totalLength - position - 1]  
                    IF lastBit = 1 THEN  
                        SET accumulatedResult ← accumulatedResult - 1  
                        BREAK OUT OF LOOP  
                    END IF  
                    SET lastBit ← 1  
                DEFAULT:  
                    SET lastBit ← 0  
            END SWITCH  
            SET position ← position + 1  
        END WHILE

        RETURN accumulatedResult + 1  
    END FUNCTION  
END CLASS

CLASS Solution
    FUNCTION kthSmallestPrimeFraction(arr, k)
        LET totalElements BE LENGTH(arr)
        LET heapElements BE an EMPTY LIST

        LET indexCounter BE 0
        WHILE indexCounter < totalElements - 1
            LET fractionValue BE arr[indexCounter] DIVIDED_BY arr[totalElements - 1]
            INSERT (fractionValue, indexCounter, totalElements - 1) INTO heapElements
            SET indexCounter TO indexCounter + 1
        END WHILE

        LET iterationCounter BE 0
        WHILE iterationCounter < k - 1
            EXTRACT_MIN FROM heapElements INTO (_, idxA, idxB)
            IF (idxB - 1) > idxA THEN
                LET newFraction BE arr[idxA] DIVIDED_BY arr[idxB - 1]
                INSERT (newFraction, idxA, idxB - 1) INTO heapElements
            END IF
            SET iterationCounter TO iterationCounter + 1
        END WHILE

        EXTRACT_MIN FROM heapElements INTO (_, finalI, finalJ)
        RETURN [arr[finalI], arr[finalJ]]
    END FUNCTION
END CLASS

CLASS Solution  
    FUNCTION racecar(target)  
        DECLARE sequence ← new double ended queue containing [(0, 1, 0)]  
        DECLARE visited ← empty set  
        INSERT (0, 1) INTO visited  
        
        LOOP indefinitely  
            IF sequence IS empty THEN BREAK  
            END IF  
            
            POP (current_pos, current_spd, current_steps) FROM the front of sequence  
            
            SWITCH  
                CASE current_pos = target:  
                    RETURN current_steps  
                DEFAULT:  
                    CONTINUE  
            END SWITCH  
            
            SET projected_pos TO current_pos + current_spd  
            SET projected_spd TO current_spd × 2  
            
            IF NOT ((projected_pos, projected_spd) IN visited) AND 0 ≤ projected_pos < (2 × target) THEN  
                INSERT (projected_pos, projected_spd) INTO visited  
                ENQUEUE (projected_pos, projected_spd, current_steps + 1) TO the rear of sequence  
            END IF  
            
            DECLARE alt_spd  
            IF current_spd > 0 THEN  
                alt_spd ← -1  
            ELSE  
                alt_spd ← +1  
            END IF  
            
            IF NOT ((current_pos, alt_spd) IN visited) AND 0 ≤ current_pos < (2 × target) THEN  
                INSERT (current_pos, alt_spd) INTO visited  
                ENQUEUE (current_pos, alt_spd, current_steps + 1) TO the rear of sequence  
            END IF  
        END LOOP  
    END FUNCTION  
END CLASS

CLASS Solution
    FUNCTION new21Game(n INTEGER, k INTEGER, maxPts INTEGER) RETURNS FLOAT
        FUNCTION dfs(pos INTEGER) RETURNS FLOAT
            SWITCH TRUE
                CASE pos >= k:
                    RETURN 1.0 IF pos <= n ELSE 0.0
                CASE pos = k - 1:
                    LET coverage FLOAT = n - k + 1
                    RETURN coverage / maxPts IF coverage < maxPts ELSE 1.0
            END SWITCH

            LET valStart FLOAT = dfs(pos + 1)
            LET valEnd FLOAT = dfs(pos + maxPts + 1)
            LET outcome FLOAT = valStart + (valStart - valEnd) / maxPts
            RETURN outcome
        END FUNCTION

        RETURN dfs(0)
    END FUNCTION
END CLASS

            IF i GREATER THAN OR EQUAL TO k THEN  
                IF i LESS THAN OR EQUAL TO n THEN  
                    RETURN one  
                ELSE  
                    RETURN zero  
                END IF  
            END IF  
            IF i EQUALS k MINUS one THEN  
                IF n MINUS k PLUS one LESS THAN maxPts THEN  
                    RETURN (n MINUS k PLUS one) DIVIDED BY maxPts  
                ELSE  
                    RETURN one  
                END IF  
            END IF  
            SET first_call TO dfs(i PLUS one)  
            SET second_call TO dfs(i PLUS maxPts PLUS one)  
            SET result TO first_call PLUS (first_call MINUS second_call) DIVIDED BY maxPts  
            RETURN result  
        END FUNCTION  
        RETURN dfs(zero)  
    END FUNCTION

CLASS Solution  
    FUNCTION numMagicSquaresInside(grid)  
        FUNCTION is_magic(i, j)  
            IF grid[i][j] ≠ 5 THEN  
                RETURN False  
            END IF  

            SET unique_values AS empty set  
            SET a AS i - 1  
            WHILE a ≤ i + 1 DO  
                SET b AS j - 1  
                WHILE b ≤ j + 1 DO  
                    SET val AS grid[a][b]  
                    IF val < 1 OR val > 9 OR val IN unique_values THEN  
                        RETURN False  
                    END IF  
                    INSERT val INTO unique_values  
                    b ← b + 1  
                END WHILE  
                a ← a + 1  
            END WHILE  

            SET c AS i - 1  
            REPEAT UNTIL c > i + 1  
                SET row_sum AS grid[c][j - 1] + grid[c][j] + grid[c][j + 1]  
                SET col_sum AS grid[i - 1][c] + grid[i][c] + grid[i + 1][c]  

                IF row_sum ≠ 15 THEN  
                    RETURN False  
                ELSE IF col_sum ≠ 15 THEN  
                    RETURN False  
                END IF  

                c ← c + 1  
            END REPEAT  

            SWITCH TRUE  
                CASE grid[i - 1][j - 1] + grid[i][j] + grid[i + 1][j + 1] ≠ 15:  
                    RETURN False  
                CASE grid[i - 1][j + 1] + grid[i][j] + grid[i + 1][j - 1] ≠ 15:  
                    RETURN False  
            END SWITCH  

            RETURN True  
        END FUNCTION  

        SET total_count AS 0  
        SET row_count AS LENGTH(grid)  
        SET column_count AS LENGTH(grid[0])  
        SET idx_i AS 1  
        WHILE idx_i < row_count - 1 DO  
            SET idx_j AS 1  
            WHILE idx_j < column_count - 1 DO  
                IF is_magic(idx_i, idx_j) THEN  
                    total_count ← total_count + 1  
                END IF  
                idx_j ← idx_j + 1  
            END WHILE  
            idx_i ← idx_i + 1  
        END WHILE  

        RETURN total_count  
    END FUNCTION  
END CLASS

    FUNCTION sumSubseqWidths(nums)

        WHILE pointer LESS THAN count
            ASSIGN (accumulator PLUS (nums[pointer] TIMES (powers[pointer] MINUS powers[count MINUS pointer MINUS 1]))) MOD MOD TO accumulator
            INCREMENT pointer BY 1
        END WHILE

        RETURN accumulator
    END FUNCTION

CLASS Solution  
    FUNCTION atMostNGivenDigitSet(digits, n)  
        FUNCTION numbers_of_length(k)  
            VAR base_num <- LENGTH OF digits  
            VAR total_count <- 1  
            VAR step <- 0  
            WHILE step < k  
                total_count <- total_count * base_num  
                step <- step + 1  
            END WHILE  
            RETURN total_count  
        END FUNCTION  
        
        FUNCTION count_up_to_limit(limit)  
            VAR rep <- TO_STRING(limit)  
            VAR len_rep <- LENGTH OF rep  
            VAR acc <- 0  
            
            VAR idx <- 1  
            LOOP UNTIL idx >= len_rep  
                acc <- acc + numbers_of_length(idx)  
                idx <- idx + 1  
            END LOOP  
            
            VAR pos <- 0  
            WHILE pos < len_rep  
                VAR val <- TO_INTEGER(rep[pos])  
                VAR j <- 0  
                
                REPEAT  
                    IF j >= LENGTH OF digits THEN  
                        BREAK  
                    END IF  
                    
                    VAR d_val <- TO_INTEGER(digits[j])  
                    
                    IF d_val < val THEN  
                        acc <- acc + numbers_of_length(len_rep - pos - 1)  
                        j <- j + 1  
                    ELSE IF d_val = val THEN  
                        IF pos = len_rep - 1 THEN  
                            acc <- acc + 1  
                        END IF  
                        BREAK  
                    ELSE  
                        BREAK  
                    END IF  
                UNTIL FALSE  
                pos <- pos + 1  
            END WHILE  
            
            RETURN acc  
        END FUNCTION  
        
        RETURN count_up_to_limit(n)  
    END FUNCTION  
END CLASS

CLASS Solution
    FUNCTION leastOpsExpressTarget(x, target)
        FUNCTION dp(target_inner)
            IF NOT (target_inner ≠ 0) THEN
                RETURN -1
            END IF

            IF target_inner >= x THEN
                INTEGER exponent_tracker ← 1
                WHILE POWER(x, exponent_tracker) ≤ target_inner DO
                    exponent_tracker ← exponent_tracker + 1
                END WHILE
                exponent_tracker ← exponent_tracker - 1

                INTEGER intermediate_value ← dp(target_inner - POWER(x, exponent_tracker)) + exponent_tracker

                INTEGER candidate ← POWER(x, exponent_tracker + 1) - target_inner
                IF candidate < target_inner THEN
                    INTEGER alternate_value ← dp(candidate) + exponent_tracker + 1
                    intermediate_value ← (intermediate_value < alternate_value) ? intermediate_value : alternate_value
                END IF

                RETURN intermediate_value
            ELSE
                INTEGER left_option ← 2 * target_inner - 1
                INTEGER right_option ← 2 * (x - target_inner)
                RETURN (left_option < right_option) ? left_option : right_option
            END IF
        END FUNCTION

        RETURN dp(target)
    END FUNCTION
END CLASS

    FUNCTION leastOpsExpressTarget(x, target)  
        FUNCTION dp(target_inner)  
            IF target_inner EQUALS zero  
                RETURN negative one  
            END IF  
            
            IF target_inner LESS THAN x  
                RETURN the minimum BETWEEN the expression two MULTIPLIED BY target_inner MINUS one AND the expression two MULTIPLIED BY the difference BETWEEN x MINUS target_inner  
            END IF  
            
            SET power TO one  
            WHILE x RAISED TO power IS LESS THAN OR EQUAL TO target_inner  
                INCREMENT power BY one  
            END WHILE  
            DECREMENT power BY one  
            
            SET result TO the value returned BY dp WITH the argument target_inner MINUS x RAISED TO power PLUS power  
            
            IF the expression x RAISED TO the sum OF power PLUS one MINUS target_inner IS LESS THAN target_inner  
                SET result TO the minimum BETWEEN result AND the value returned BY dp WITH the argument x RAISED TO the sum OF power PLUS one MINUS target_inner PLUS power PLUS one  
            END IF  
            
            RETURN result  
        END FUNCTION  
        
        RETURN the value returned BY dp WITH the argument target  
    END FUNCTION

CLASS Solution  
    FUNCTION isRationalEqual WITH PARAMETER s OF TYPE string WITH PARAMETER t OF TYPE string RETURNS boolean  
        SET fractions AS [1, 1/9, 1/99, 1/999, 1/9999]  

        FUNCTION valueOf WITH PARAMETER s OF TYPE string RETURNS a floating point number  
            SET openPos TO INDEX_OF('(' IN s)  
            IF openPos IS NOT_EQUAL_TO -1 THEN  
                SET closePos TO INDEX_OF(')' IN s)  
                SET decimalPos TO INDEX_OF('.' IN s)  
                SET baseValue TO TO_FLOAT(SUBSTRING(s, 0, openPos))  
                SET nonRepeatCount TO openPos - decimalPos - 1  
                SET repeatValue TO TO_INT(SUBSTRING(s, openPos + 1, closePos))  
                SET repeatLength TO closePos - openPos - 1  

                SET part1 TO repeatValue * fractions[repeatLength]  
                SET part2 TO part1 / (10 ^ nonRepeatCount)  
                RETURN baseValue + part2  
            END IF  
            RETURN TO_FLOAT(s)  
        END FUNCTION  

        SET diff TO ABS(valueOf(s) - valueOf(t))  
        RETURN diff < (1 / (10 ^ 9))  
    END FUNCTION  
END CLASS

    FUNCTION isRationalEqual WITH PARAMETER s OF TYPE string WITH PARAMETER t OF TYPE string RETURNS boolean  
        SET ratios TO a list containing one FOLLOWED BY one DIVIDED BY nine FOLLOWED BY one DIVIDED BY ninety nine FOLLOWED BY one DIVIDED BY nine hundred ninety nine FOLLOWED BY one DIVIDED BY nine thousand nine hundred ninety nine  

        FUNCTION valueOf WITH PARAMETER s OF TYPE string RETURNS a floating point number  
            IF position of opening parenthesis in s EQUALS negative one  
                RETURN the conversion of s TO a floating point number  
            END IF  

            SET leftParenIndex TO position of opening parenthesis in s  
            SET rightParenIndex TO position of closing parenthesis in s  
            SET dotIndex TO position of decimal point in s  

            SET integerAndNonRepeating TO the conversion TO floating point number OF the substring of s from the start TO the position leftParenIndex minus one  
            SET nonRepeatingLength TO leftParenIndex MINUS dotIndex MINUS one  

            SET repeating TO the conversion TO integer OF the substring of s from position leftParenIndex PLUS one TO position rightParenIndex MINUS one  
            SET repeatingLength TO rightParenIndex MINUS leftParenIndex MINUS one  
            RETURN integerAndNonRepeating PLUS repeating MULTIPLIED BY the number one DIVIDED BY ten RAISED TO the power of nonRepeatingLength MULTIPLIED BY element at position repeatingLength OF the list ratios  
        END FUNCTION  

        RETURN the absolute value of valueOf of s MINUS valueOf of t LESS THAN one DIVIDED BY ten RAISED TO the power of nine  
    END FUNCTION  
END CLASS

    FUNCTION canConvert WITH PARAMETERS str1 str2
        IF NOT (str1 IS NOT str2) THEN
            RETURN True
        END IF

        DEFINE char_to_char_map AS empty dictionary

        SET index_var TO 0
        WHILE index_var LESS THAN LENGTH(str1)
            ASSIGN charA TO str1 AT index_var
            ASSIGN charB TO str2 AT index_var

            IF charA IN char_to_char_map THEN
                IF NOT (char_to_char_map[charA] EQUALS charB) THEN
                    RETURN False
                END IF
            ELSE
                ASSIGN charB TO char_to_char_map AT charA
            END IF

            INCREMENT index_var BY 1
        END WHILE

        IF LENGTH(SET OF ELEMENTS OF str2) GREATER THAN OR EQUAL TO 26 THEN
            RETURN False
        END IF

        RETURN True
    END FUNCTION

CLASS Solution
    FUNCTION sortItems(n, m, group, beforeItems)
        SET next_group_id TO m
        SET idx TO 0
        WHILE idx LESS THAN n
            IF group[idx] EQUALS -1
                ASSIGN next_group_id TO group[idx]
                INCREMENT next_group_id
            END IF
            INCREMENT idx
        END WHILE

        ASSIGN group_contents TO empty dictionary mapping keys to empty lists
        ASSIGN adjacency_per_group TO empty dictionary mapping keys to empty lists
        ASSIGN adjacency_per_item TO empty dictionary mapping keys to empty lists
        ASSIGN in_degree_per_item TO list of zeros repeated n times
        ASSIGN in_degree_per_group TO list of zeros repeated next_group_id times

        ASSIGN index_var TO 0
        WHILE index_var LESS THAN n
            APPEND index_var TO group_contents[group[index_var]]
            INCREMENT index_var
        END WHILE

        SET outer_index TO 0
        WHILE outer_index LESS THAN n
            SET inner_index TO 0
            SET current_dependencies TO beforeItems[outer_index]
            WHILE inner_index LESS THAN LENGTH OF current_dependencies
                SET dependency TO current_dependencies[inner_index]
                IF NOT (group[dependency] DIFFERENT FROM group[outer_index])
                    APPEND outer_index TO adjacency_per_item[dependency]
                    in_degree_per_item[outer_index] = in_degree_per_item[outer_index] + 1
                ELSE
                    APPEND group[outer_index] TO adjacency_per_group[group[dependency]]
                    in_degree_per_group[group[outer_index]] = in_degree_per_group[group[outer_index]] + 1
                END IF
                INCREMENT inner_index
            END WHILE
            INCREMENT outer_index
        END WHILE

        FUNCTION topological_sort(graph, in_degree, items)
            ASSIGN processing_queue TO empty double-ended queue
            ASSIGN collected_result TO empty list

            FOR each element IN items
                IF in_degree[element] EQUALS 0
                    APPEND element TO processing_queue
                END IF
            END FOR

            WHILE LENGTH OF processing_queue GREATER THAN 0
                REMOVE front OF processing_queue AND STORE IN current_node
                APPEND current_node TO collected_result
                ASSIGN neighbors TO graph[current_node]
                ASSIGN neighbor_counter TO 0
                WHILE neighbor_counter LESS THAN LENGTH OF neighbors
                    SET neighbor TO neighbors[neighbor_counter]
                    DECREMENT in_degree[neighbor] BY 1
                    IF in_degree[neighbor] EQUALS 0
                        APPEND neighbor TO processing_queue
                    END IF
                    INCREMENT neighbor_counter
                END WHILE
            END WHILE

            IF LENGTH OF collected_result EQUALS LENGTH OF items
                RETURN collected_result
            ELSE
                RETURN empty list
            END IF
        END FUNCTION

        ASSIGN global_sorted_items TO empty list
        FOR EACH group_key IN group_contents KEYS
            ASSIGN sorted_sequence TO topological_sort(adjacency_per_item, in_degree_per_item, group_contents[group_key])
            IF LENGTH OF sorted_sequence EQUALS 0
                RETURN empty list
            END IF
            FOR each element IN sorted_sequence
                APPEND element TO global_sorted_items
            END FOR
        END FOR

        ASSIGN sorted_group_order TO topological_sort(adjacency_per_group, in_degree_per_group, LIST OF INTEGERS FROM 0 TO next_group_id MINUS 1)
        IF LENGTH OF sorted_group_order EQUALS 0
            RETURN empty list
        END IF

        ASSIGN ordered_items_per_group TO empty dictionary mapping keys to empty lists
        FOR EACH sorted_item IN global_sorted_items
            APPEND sorted_item TO ordered_items_per_group[group[sorted_item]]
        END FOR

        ASSIGN final_sorted_list TO empty list
        FOR EACH group_in_order IN sorted_group_order
            CONCATENATE ordered_items_per_group[group_in_order] TO final_sorted_list
        END FOR

        RETURN final_sorted_list
    END FUNCTION
END CLASS

CLASS Solution  
    FUNCTION sortItems(n, m, group, beforeItems)  
        FOR i FROM zero TO n MINUS one  
            IF element at position i of group EQUALS minus one  
                SET element at position i of group TO m  
                INCREMENT m BY one  
            END IF  
        END FOR  
        
        SET group_items TO a mapping from keys to empty lists  
        SET group_graph TO a mapping from keys to empty lists  
        SET item_graph TO a mapping from keys to empty lists  
        SET item_in_degree TO a list consisting of zero repeated n times  
        SET group_in_degree TO a list consisting of zero repeated m times  
        
        FOR i FROM zero TO n MINUS one  
            APPEND i TO list at key element at position i of group in group_items  
        END FOR  
        
        FOR i FROM zero TO n MINUS one  
            FOR each before_element IN element at position i of beforeItems  
                IF element at position before_element of group EQUALS element at position i of group  
                    APPEND i TO list at key before_element in item_graph  
                    INCREMENT element at position i of item_in_degree BY one  
                ELSE  
                    APPEND element at position i of group TO list at key element at position before_element of group in group_graph  
                    INCREMENT element at position element at position i of group of group_in_degree BY one  
                END IF  
            END FOR  
        END FOR  
        
        FUNCTION topological_sort(graph, in_degree, items)  
            SET queue TO a double-ended queue initialized with elements from items WHERE element at position element of in_degree EQUALS zero  
            SET result TO empty list  
            
            WHILE queue is not empty  
                REMOVE element from front of queue and assign to u  
                APPEND u TO result  
                FOR each v IN list at key u in graph  
                    DECREMENT element at position v of in_degree BY one  
                    IF element at position v of in_degree EQUALS zero  
                        APPEND v TO queue  
                    END IF  
                END FOR  
            END WHILE  
            
            IF LENGTH OF result EQUALS LENGTH OF items  
                RETURN result  
            ELSE  
                RETURN empty list  
            END IF  
        END FUNCTION  
        
        SET sorted_within_groups TO empty list  
        FOR each items_list IN all values of group_items  
            SET sorted_items TO topological_sort(item_graph, item_in_degree, items_list)  
            IF LENGTH OF sorted_items EQUALS zero  
                RETURN empty list  
            END IF  
            EXTEND sorted_within_groups BY sorted_items  
        END FOR  
        
        SET sorted_groups TO topological_sort(group_graph, group_in_degree, list of elements from zero TO m MINUS one)  
        IF LENGTH OF sorted_groups EQUALS zero  
            RETURN empty list  
        END IF  
        
        SET group_to_items_map TO a mapping from keys to empty lists  
        FOR each item IN sorted_within_groups  
            APPEND item TO list at key element at position item of group in group_to_items_map  
        END FOR  
        
        SET result TO empty list  
        FOR each grp IN sorted_groups  
            EXTEND result BY list at key grp in group_to_items_map  
        END FOR  
        
        RETURN result  
    END FUNCTION  
END CLASS

CLASS Solution
    FUNCTION countVowelPermutation(n)
        DEFINE DIVISOR AS 1_000_000_007
        INITIALIZE alpha AS 1
        INITIALIZE beta AS 1
        INITIALIZE gamma AS 1
        INITIALIZE delta AS 1
        INITIALIZE epsilon AS 1

        SET counter TO 2
        WHILE counter ≤ n DO
            DEFINE next_alpha AS beta + gamma + epsilon
            DEFINE next_beta AS alpha + gamma
            DEFINE next_gamma AS beta + delta
            DEFINE next_delta AS gamma
            DEFINE next_epsilon AS gamma + delta

            alpha ← next_alpha MODULO DIVISOR
            beta ← next_beta MODULO DIVISOR
            gamma ← next_gamma MODULO DIVISOR
            delta ← next_delta MODULO DIVISOR
            epsilon ← next_epsilon MODULO DIVISOR

            INCREMENT counter BY 1
        END WHILE

        COMPUTE aggregate_total = alpha + beta + gamma + delta + epsilon
        ASSIGN final_result AS aggregate_total MODULO DIVISOR
        RETURN final_result
    END FUNCTION
END CLASS

    FUNCTION maximizeSweetness(sweetness list OF integer, k integer) RETURNS integer

                ASSIGN mid_val TO final_ans
                ASSIGN mid_val PLUS 1 TO low

            ELSE
                ASSIGN mid_val MINUS 1 TO high
            END IF
        END WHILE

        RETURN final_ans
    END FUNCTION

        FOR idx FROM 0 TO LENGTH of target MINUS 1

        END FOR

            SET remaining AS sumTotal MINUS maxValue

                CASE remaining EQUALS 0:
                    RETURN False
            END SWITCH

            SET modResult AS maxValue MINUS (remaining MULTIPLY (maxValue DIVIDED BY remaining))

                RETURN False
            END IF

            SET sumTotal TO remaining PLUS modResult
            INSERT NEGATION of modResult INTO heapData AS a heap element
        END WHILE

        RETURN True
    END FUNCTION

                    END IF

                INCREMENT inner_idx BY 1
            END WHILE
            INCREMENT outer_index BY 1
        END WHILE

CLASS Solution
    FUNCTION cherryPickup(grid)
        SET totalRows AS LENGTH(grid)
        SET totalCols AS LENGTH(grid[0])
        
        FUNCTION dp(r c1 c2)
            IF (c1 < 0) OR (c1 >= totalCols) OR (c2 < 0) OR (c2 >= totalCols) THEN
                RETURN 0
            END IF

            IF c1 = c2 THEN
                SET gathered AS grid[r][c1]
            ELSE
                SET gathered AS grid[r][c1] + grid[r][c2]
            END IF

            IF r = totalRows - 1 THEN
                RETURN gathered
            END IF
            
            SET supremeValue TO 0
            SET deltaIndexOneList TO [-1 0 1]
            SET deltaIndexTwoList TO [-1 0 1]
            SET outerCounter TO 0
            WHILE outerCounter < LENGTH(deltaIndexOneList)
                SET innerCounter TO 0
                WHILE innerCounter < LENGTH(deltaIndexTwoList)
                    SET candidateSum TO dp(r + 1 c1 + deltaIndexOneList[outerCounter] c2 + deltaIndexTwoList[innerCounter])
                    IF candidateSum > supremeValue THEN
                        supremeValue ← candidateSum
                    END IF
                    innerCounter ← innerCounter + 1
                END WHILE
                outerCounter ← outerCounter + 1
            END WHILE

            RETURN gathered + supremeValue
        END FUNCTION

        RETURN dp(0 0 totalCols - 1)
    END FUNCTION
END CLASS

CLASS Solution
    FUNCTION minNumberOfSemesters(n k relations)
        INITIALIZE graph AS a mapping with default empty list for unseen keys
        INITIALIZE in_degree AS a list containing (n + 1) zeros
        
        SET edgeIndex TO 0
        WHILE edgeIndex < LENGTH(relations)
            SET fromNode TO relations[edgeIndex][0]
            SET toNode TO relations[edgeIndex][1]
            ADD toNode TO graph[fromNode]
            SET in_degree[toNode] TO in_degree[toNode] + 1
            INCREMENT edgeIndex BY 1
        END WHILE
        
        INITIALIZE pendingCourses AS empty deque
        SET courseID TO 1
        LOOP
            IF courseID > n THEN BREAK
            IF in_degree[courseID] = 0 THEN
                APPEND courseID TO pendingCourses
            END IF
            INCREMENT courseID BY 1
        END LOOP
        
        SET semesterCount TO 0
        
        WHILE LENGTH(pendingCourses) > 0
            SET maxCoursesThisRound TO k
            IF maxCoursesThisRound > LENGTH(pendingCourses) THEN
                SET maxCoursesThisRound TO LENGTH(pendingCourses)
            END IF
            
            SET counter TO 0
            RECURSIVE_PROCESS:
                IF counter >= maxCoursesThisRound THEN
                    GOTO FINISH_PROCESS
                END IF
                
                SET currentCourse TO REMOVE_LEFT(pendingCourses)
                FOR every adjacentCourse IN graph[currentCourse]
                    SET in_degree[adjacentCourse] TO in_degree[adjacentCourse] - 1
                    IF in_degree[adjacentCourse] = 0 THEN
                        APPEND adjacentCourse TO pendingCourses
                    END IF
                END FOR
                
                SET counter TO counter + 1
                GOTO RECURSIVE_PROCESS
            FINISH_PROCESS:
            
            SET semesterCount TO semesterCount + 1
        END WHILE
        
        RETURN semesterCount
    END FUNCTION
END CLASS

                    END IF

            INCREMENT semesters BY one  
        END WHILE

CLASS Solution
    FUNCTION getMinDistSum(positions)
        LET totalPoints ← LENGTH OF positions
        LET centerX ← 0
        LET centerY ← 0
        FOR each coord IN positions DO
            LET px ← coord[0]
            LET py ← coord[1]
            centerX ← centerX + px
            centerY ← centerY + py
        END FOR
        centerX ← centerX / totalPoints
        centerY ← centerY / totalPoints

        LET shrinkFactor ← 0.999
        LET threshold ← 0.000001
        LET rate ← 0.5

        REPEAT
            LET gradientX ← 0
            LET gradientY ← 0
            LET totalDistance ← 0
            FOR each coord IN positions DO
                LET xVal ← coord[0]
                LET yVal ← coord[1]
                LET diffX ← centerX - xVal
                LET diffY ← centerY - yVal
                LET distVal ← SQRT(diffX * diffX + diffY * diffY)
                gradientX ← gradientX + (diffX / distVal + 0.00000001)
                gradientY ← gradientY + (diffY / distVal + 0.00000001)
                totalDistance ← totalDistance + distVal
            END FOR

            LET stepX ← gradientX * rate
            LET stepY ← gradientY * rate

            centerX ← centerX - stepX
            centerY ← centerY - stepY

            rate ← rate * shrinkFactor

            IF (ABS(stepX) ≤ threshold) AND (ABS(stepY) ≤ threshold) THEN
                RETURN totalDistance
            END IF
        UNTIL FALSE
    END FUNCTION
END CLASS

                OUTPUT 0

                    SET lowest_cost TO segment_cost
                END IF
                
                ADD 1 TO index_tracker
            END WHILE
            
            OUTPUT lowest_cost

    END FUNCTION

    FUNCTION createSortedArray(instructions)  
        ASSIGN MOD ← 1 + (10 ^ 9)  
        ASSIGN MAX ← 1 + MAX_VALUE(instructions)  
        ASSIGN bit ← LIST_OF_ZEROS_WITH_LENGTH(MAX)  

        FUNCTION update(idx val)  
            LOOP  
                IF NOT (idx < MAX) THEN BREAK  
                bit[idx] ← bit[idx] + val  
                idx ← idx + (idx AND (-idx))  
            END LOOP  
        END FUNCTION  

        FUNCTION query(idx)

            LET i ← i_num[0]

            ASSIGN greater_than ← i - query(num)  
            IF less_than <= greater_than THEN  
                ASSIGN cost ← less_than  
            ELSE  
                ASSIGN cost ← greater_than  
            END IF  
            total_cost ← (total_cost + cost) MOD MOD  
            CALL update(num, 1)  
        END FOR  

        RETURN total_cost  
    END FUNCTION

CLASS Solution  
    FUNCTION minimumIncompatibility(nums k)  
        LET totalElements ← LENGTH nums  
        LET sizePerSubset ← totalElements DIV k  
        LET elementCounts ← COUNT ELEMENTS IN nums  
        
        FOR countValue IN elementCounts.VALUES  
            IF countValue > k THEN RETURN -1  
        END FOR  
        
        LET incompatibilityMap ← EMPTY DICTIONARY  
        LET maxMask ← (2 POWER totalElements) - 1  
        LET currentMask ← 0  
        
        WHILE currentMask <= maxMask DO  
            LET bitsSet ← COUNT OF BITS SET IN currentMask  
            
            IF bitsSet = sizePerSubset THEN  
                LET collected ← EMPTY LIST  
                LET index ← 0  
                
                WHILE index < totalElements DO  
                    IF (currentMask BITWISE-AND (2 POWER index)) ≠ 0 THEN  
                        collected.APPEND(nums[index])  
                    END IF  
                    index ← index + 1  
                END WHILE  
                
                LET uniqueElements ← SET OF collected  
                IF LENGTH uniqueElements = sizePerSubset THEN  
                    LET maxVal ← MAX OF collected  
                    LET minVal ← MIN OF collected  
                    LET diff ← maxVal - minVal  
                    incompatibilityMap[currentMask] ← diff  
                END IF  
            END IF  
            
            currentMask ← currentMask + 1  
        END WHILE  
        
        LET dpArray ← ARRAY OF SIZE (2 POWER totalElements) FILLED WITH INFINITY  
        dpArray[0] ← 0  
        
        FOR maskValue FROM 0 TO maxMask DO  
            IF (COUNT OF BITS SET IN maskValue) MOD sizePerSubset ≠ 0 THEN CONTINUE  
            
            FOR each candidateSubset IN incompatibilityMap.KEYS DO  
                IF (maskValue BITWISE-AND candidateSubset) = candidateSubset THEN  
                    LET attempt ← dpArray[maskValue - candidateSubset] + incompatibilityMap[candidateSubset]  
                    IF attempt < dpArray[maskValue] THEN  
                        dpArray[maskValue] ← attempt  
                    END IF  
                END IF  
            END FOR  
        END FOR  
        
        LET fullSetMask ← maxMask  
        IF dpArray[fullSetMask] ≠ INFINITY THEN  
            RETURN dpArray[fullSetMask]  
        ELSE  
            RETURN -1  
        END IF  
    END FUNCTION  
END CLASS

        SET dp AT position zero TO zero  
        FOR mask FROM zero TO TWO RAISED TO THE POWER OF n MINUS one  
            IF the REMAINDER OF the NUMBER OF ONES IN the BINARY REPRESENTATION OF mask DIVIDED BY subset_size IS NOT EQUAL TO zero THEN  
                CONTINUE TO the NEXT iteration  
            END IF  
            FOR each subset_mask IN the KEYS OF subset_incompatibility  
                IF the BITWISE AND OF mask AND subset_mask EQUALS subset_mask THEN  
                    SET candidate_value TO dp AT position mask MINUS subset_mask PLUS subset_incompatibility AT subset_mask  
                    IF candidate_value IS LESS THAN dp AT position mask THEN  
                        SET dp AT position mask TO candidate_value  
                    END IF  
                END IF  
            END FOR  
        END FOR  
        SET full_mask TO TWO RAISED TO THE POWER OF n MINUS one  
        IF dp AT position full_mask IS NOT EQUAL TO infinity THEN  
            RETURN dp AT position full_mask  
        ELSE  
            RETURN negative one  
        END IF  
    END FUNCTION  
END CLASS

CLASS Solution
    FUNCTION canMouseWin(grid, catJump, mouseJump)
        ASSIGN rows_count ← SIZE OF grid
        ASSIGN cols_count ← SIZE OF grid AT zero
        ASSIGN cat_init ← 0
        ASSIGN mouse_init ← 0
        ASSIGN food_pos ← 0
        ASSIGN directions ← [ -1, 0, 1, 0, -1 ]
        ASSIGN mouse_graph ← LIST OF EMPTY LISTS REPEATED rows_count * cols_count TIMES
        ASSIGN cat_graph ← LIST OF EMPTY LISTS REPEATED rows_count * cols_count TIMES

        FOR each row_index, row_val IN ENUMERATE(grid)
            FOR each col_index, cell IN ENUMERATE(row_val)
                IF cell IS EQUAL TO '#'
                    CONTINUE TO NEXT LOOP ITERATION
                END IF
                ASSIGN vertex ← (row_index * cols_count) + col_index
                IF cell IS 'C'
                    ASSIGN cat_init ← vertex
                ELSE IF cell IS 'M'
                    ASSIGN mouse_init ← vertex
                ELSE IF cell IS 'F'
                    ASSIGN food_pos ← vertex
                END IF

                FOR pos IN 0 TO LENGTH(directions) - 2
                    ASSIGN delta_x ← directions[pos]
                    ASSIGN delta_y ← directions[pos + 1]

                    FOR step FROM 0 TO mouseJump
                        ASSIGN new_x ← row_index + step * delta_x
                        ASSIGN new_y ← col_index + step * delta_y
                        IF new_x < 0 OR new_x >= rows_count OR new_y < 0 OR new_y >= cols_count OR grid[new_x][new_y] = '#'
                            LEAVE INNER LOOP
                        END IF
                        APPEND (new_x * cols_count + new_y) TO mouse_graph[vertex]
                    END FOR

                    FOR step FROM 0 TO catJump
                        ASSIGN new_x ← row_index + step * delta_x
                        ASSIGN new_y ← col_index + step * delta_y
                        IF new_x < 0 OR new_x >= rows_count OR new_y < 0 OR new_y >= cols_count OR grid[new_x][new_y] = '#'
                            LEAVE INNER LOOP
                        END IF
                        APPEND (new_x * cols_count + new_y) TO cat_graph[vertex]
                    END FOR
                END FOR
            END FOR
        END FOR
        RETURN calc(mouse_graph, cat_graph, mouse_init, cat_init, food_pos) IS EQUAL TO 1
    END FUNCTION

    FUNCTION calc(g_mouse, g_cat, mouse_start, cat_start, hole)
        FUNCTION get_prev_states(state)
            ASSIGN mouse_pos ← state[0]
            ASSIGN cat_pos ← state[1]
            ASSIGN turn_indicator ← state[2]
            ASSIGN prev_turn ← turn_indicator XOR 1
            ASSIGN results ← EMPTY LIST

            IF prev_turn = 1
                FOR each candidate_cat IN g_cat[cat_pos]
                    IF ans[mouse_pos][candidate_cat][1] = 0
                        APPEND (mouse_pos, candidate_cat, prev_turn) TO results
                    END IF
                END FOR
            ELSE
                FOR each candidate_mouse IN g_mouse[mouse_pos]
                    IF ans[candidate_mouse][cat_pos][0] = 0
                        APPEND (candidate_mouse, cat_pos, 0) TO results
                    END IF
                END FOR
            END IF
            RETURN results
        END FUNCTION

        ASSIGN total_states ← SIZE OF g_mouse
        ASSIGN degree ← 3D ARRAY FILLED WITH 0 WITH DIMENSIONS [total_states][total_states][2]

        FOR outer FROM 0 TO total_states - 1
            FOR inner FROM 0 TO total_states - 1
                degree[outer][inner][0] ← SIZE OF g_mouse[outer]
                degree[outer][inner][1] ← SIZE OF g_cat[inner]
            END FOR
        END FOR

        ASSIGN ans ← 3D ARRAY FILLED WITH 0 WITH DIMENSIONS [total_states][total_states][2]
        ASSIGN queue ← EMPTY DOUBLE-ENDED QUEUE

        FOR index FROM 0 TO total_states - 1
            ans[hole][index][1] ← 1
            ans[index][hole][0] ← 2
            ans[index][index][1] ← 2
            ans[index][index][0] ← 2

            APPEND (hole, index, 1) TO queue
            APPEND (index, hole, 0) TO queue
            APPEND (index, index, 0) TO queue
            APPEND (index, index, 1) TO queue
        END FOR

        WHILE queue IS NOT EMPTY
            ASSIGN current_state ← POP LEFT FROM queue
            ASSIGN current_value ← ans[current_state[0]][current_state[1]][current_state[2]]

            FOR each predecessor IN get_prev_states(current_state)
                ASSIGN pm ← predecessor[0]
                ASSIGN pc ← predecessor[1]
                ASSIGN pt ← predecessor[2]

                IF pt = current_value - 1
                    ans[pm][pc][pt] ← current_value
                    APPEND predecessor TO queue
                ELSE
                    degree[pm][pc][pt] ← degree[pm][pc][pt] - 1
                    IF degree[pm][pc][pt] = 0
                        ans[pm][pc][pt] ← current_value
                        APPEND predecessor TO queue
                    END IF
                END IF
            END FOR
        END WHILE
        RETURN ans[mouse_start][cat_start][0]
    END FUNCTION
END CLASS
